A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: A terrible movie. So many plot holes. All you had to do Rian Johnson was follow Episode 7's arc. Just follow the arc. You are making a second movie in a trilogy. Follow the arc. Instead\, you introduced random elements and extinguished several plots from episode 7. That isnt your job. Your job was to continue the arc from episode 7 and build upon that story. Instead\, you just wrote a tangential story that didnt progress the story that was started in episode 7. This makes no sense. There were so many stories in episode 7 that just disappeared. Which is fine if you are making a different story\, but you are making the second chapter in a trilogy. You didnt develop any characters\, you had so many plot holes\, you did progress any arcs and the pacing was garbage.\n\nEpisode 7 built a solid foundation for Episode 8 to expound upon and Rian Johnson just farted on it.
